alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 3:10PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF UPPER TREASURE VALLEY... LOWER TREASURE VALLEY...AND BOISE MOUNTAINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 309 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was over Kuna, or 10 miles southeast of Nampa moving northeast at 15 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Kuna around 320 PM MST. Nampa around 330 PM MST. Boise, Meridian and Blacks Creek Reservoir around 350 PM MST. Star around 400 PM MST. Garden City, Eagle, Hidden Springs and Aldape Summit around 410 PM MST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley
